So, that, that's probably my biggest is challenge, is, is, getting those guys to understand because the reason we had lost all, or they had lost all the equipment is because through various acciendents and safety mishaps, they'd had all the equipment had been broken and they guy who's in charge of fixing it had decided since they had such a poor safety record, he was going to punish them and not give them any equipment to work with. So, I had to change the culture of my guys to get them to be more safe and respect their pieces of equipment and I had to get the guy who fixes the equipment to understand that I really need the, the equipment for my guys to be able to complete their mission.
Interviewer: Alright, alright, so tell me about a time when you, or your team were not meeting an established goal or deadline, and what steps did you take to ensure that goal or dealine was met?

Veteran: When I first got here, uh, one of the things that, one of the things that my construction group would do every year was we go into the dormitories on campus, uh, and they would give us three or four of em every year, we would take them apart basically and repaint, redo, uh, fix the electrial outlets, put new base board, just a general overhaul of the dorm. When I had, when I got here and took over, the last, the two years prior, they had even though they only had four dorms they got two of them completed on time, which was totally unacceptable because when moving day comes in August, you need to be ready to be able to move the people in. So, uh, I sat down with the five foreman that I had in my outfit and we figured out how if I would put one foreman in charge of each one of the dorms and then, let them manage the people in the uh, vendors that were coming in and delivering stuff for them and all that they thought that they could, uh, turn these dorms out in a more timely fashion. And we, we took that process, we did a few modifications to it and becuase of that we were able to turn out all four dorms out at first year with two weeks to spare. And the two weeks to spare came back to haunt us, becase they gave us a fifth dorm that they wanted to turn out, but we were able to do it.

Uh, I got tasked, uh, to go up on the roof. We had to cut a trench all arcoss this building and this building was was a half mile wide. So, we had to cut a trench all the way across, so that we could get the fire fighters up there, so that they could shoot the water in to where the insulation was and put the fire out. That's uh, I work with my NCOs to get that done. My NCOs were great. I said this is what we got to do and just looked at me and said no problem.
